H0.text: I and O are the chemical symbols for the two elements found in iron oxide, which forms when iron metal reacts with oxygen in the air.

H1.text: Ir and O are the chemical symbols for the two elements found in iron oxide, which forms when iron metal reacts with oxygen in the air.

H2.text: Fe and O are the chemical symbols for the two elements found in iron oxide, which forms when iron metal reacts with oxygen in the air.

H3.text: Pb and O are the chemical symbols for the two elements found in iron oxide, which forms when iron metal reacts with oxygen in the air.

A4.text: Iron forms various oxide and hydroxide compounds; the most common are iron(II,III) oxide (Fe3O4), and iron(III) oxide (Fe2O3).

A5.text: It has symbol Fe (from Latin ferrum 'iron').
